intro: Scorzonera plurifida, commonly known as the many-leaved scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, followed by elongated, tubular fruits. Scorzonera plurifida is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are typically lobed and hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
